definitions.definition: Belief in a spiritual or metaphysical reality (often including at least one deity ), accompanied by practices or rituals pertaining to the belief.
examples: My brother tends to value religion , but my sister not as much.

definitions.definition: A particular system of such belief , and the rituals and practices proper to it.
examples: Islam is a major religion , particularly in North Africa and Southwest Asia.
Mormonism is a new religion , while Zoroastrianism is an old one.

definitions.definition: The way of life committed to by monks and nuns .
examples: The monk entered religion when he was 20 years of age.

definitions.definition: Rituals and actions associated with religious beliefs , but considered apart from them.
examples: I think some Christians would love Jesus more if they weren't so stuck in religion .
Jack's spiritual, but he's not really into religion .

definitions.definition: Any practice to which someone or some group is seriously devoted .
examples: At this point, Star Trek has really become a religion .

definitions.definition: Faithfulness to a given principle ; conscientiousness .

main_definition: ( uncountable ) Belief in a spiritual or metaphysical reality (often including at least one deity ), accompanied by practices or rituals pertaining to the belief.
secondary_definitions: ( countable ) A particular system of such belief , and the rituals and practices proper to it.
( uncountable ) The way of life committed to by monks and nuns .
( uncountable , informal ) Rituals and actions associated with religious beliefs , but considered apart from them.
( countable ) Any practice to which someone or some group is seriously devoted .
( uncountable , obsolete ) Faithfulness to a given principle ; conscientiousness . [16th–17th c.]
